result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charnpreet Singh

defendant.name: Singh, Charnpreet
defendant.address: N54W16569 Ravenwood Drive, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charnpreet Singh appeared by video.  Attorney John Scott Schiro appeared by video for Charnpreet Singh.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Court will file and sign a scheduling order to reflect the following deadlines: 11/03/2022 deadline to file any motions. 12/01/2022 deadline for Defense/ State to file any written responses. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charnpreet Singh appeared by video.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court in person for Charnpreet Singh.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek PD Officer V. Zamborini. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered the defendant to have no contact with D.S.

Defendant Charnpreet Singh in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for initial appearance.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charnpreet Singh in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for initial appearance.  Court is down today.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Attorney John Schiro
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/30/22 @ 8:30a
